page.title: 20Country By-ways.
page.content: We had many walks along country lanes, bridleways and footpaths.The{lanes were very quiet and did not have pavements,but there were grass verges which we had to use if any traffic came along.The{bridleways}are wide enough for a farmer's tractor.Horses also use them so they were often very uneven where the hooves had pressed into the ground.This made it difficult for us because when it was dry the ruts and hollows hurt our feet,but when it was wet we had to make our way through lots of puddles, some of which were very deep.The{footpaths}were much narrower and often went across fields so we had to take care that we did not damage the crops. Sometimes we had to climb over stiles which the Ramblers' Association put up. Written by 2nd and 3rd pupils and staff of Holyport C.E.Primary School.
